trial_identification.studytitle: Can depression be prevented by reducing insomnia? The Good Night Sleep Study
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The effect of an internet-based insomnia treatment program on the prevention of major depressive disorder in community members with subclinical depressive symptoms
trial_identification.secondaryid: This trial is registered with The Australian National University Human Reseach Ethics Committee (2011/041).

interventions.interventions: Internet-based insomnia treatment program (SHUTi). SHUTi is an automated self-help program consisting of a 6 week program conducted over a window of 9 weeks. Participation in the intervention involves approximately 1-2 hours per week. At five points during the study, participants will be asked to keep track of their sleep through a diary for a two week period. This will occur prior to initiation of the active intervention phase, immediately following active intervention phase, and also at 6-, 12- and18-month followups. This sleep diary takes about 5 minutes each day to complete and enter online. Participants will also be contacted to complete online questionnaires at baseline, after the intervention period (9 weeks), and then at 6, 12 and 18 months. The program is based on cognitive behaviour therapy.
interventions.comparator: Internet-delivered control condition (HealthWatch). HealthWatch requires participants to complete online open ended questions that probe health and social issues. It consists of a six part program delivered over nine weeks. Participation in the intervention involves approximately 1-2 hours per week. It delivers an online package of educational material with information about general health risks.In this condition, participants will be asked to monitor their sleep, to read information about how to improve your general health, and then answer some questions that look at ways to change their lifestyle to improve health. It contains no specific mental health information.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Reduction of depression symptoms at immediate posttest (and then 6-month, 12-month and 18-month follow-up), as measured using the PHQ-9.

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Screening, baseline, every two weeks during active intervention phase (2, 4, 6, 8 weeks), posttest, 6-, 12- and 18-month follow-ups.
Baseline, every two weeks during active intervention phase (weeks 2, 4, 6, 8), posttest, 6-, 12-, and 18-month follow-ups.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Sleep-associated monitoring. This will be assessed using the brief version of the SAMI (Sleep-Associated Monitoring Index).

Self-efficacy (both general and sleep-specific). This will be assessed using Charles Morin's measures of personal efficacy used in the original USA trials of the SHUTi web-based insomnia intervention being implemented in this trial.
Health service usage (measured through self report and through actual health data)
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Self-report at baseline, posttest, 6-, 12-, and 18-month follow-ups. Medical records data covering from 6 months prior to trial commencement through to final follow-up assessment, retrieved midway through trial and after final follow-up.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Diagnosis of Major Depressive Disorder on MINI International Neuropsychiatric Interview

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: On the Patient Health Questionnaire 9: a score between from 5 to 19, inclusive. On the Bergen Insomnia Scale: a score of 3 or above on at least one of the first four items and a score of 3 or above on at least one of the last two items. Age 18-64. Valid email address. Reliable internet access. Valid telephone number. Currently living in Australia. Proficiency with reading English.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Diagnosis of current (1 month) MDD; non-English speaking; reading difficulties; diagnosis of psychosis, schizophrenia or bipolar mood disorder by a psychiatrist; bedtime outside of 8pm-2am more than twice a week (not primarily due to insomnia); rising time outside of 4am-10am more than twice a week (not primarily due to insomnia); pregnancy at time of recruitment; current suicide plan/ high risk of suicide.

trial_design.concealment: Randomisation will be carried out using automated computer-based randomisation procedures.
trial_design.sequence: Participants will be randomised using automatised computer software on the portal, stratified by severity of symptoms and gender.
